channel.title: Posts on We Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on We Data Blog

item.title: Geneva R Lunches
item.description: By David Munoz Tord R lunches are multidisciplinary meetings on R at UniMail. We finished this semester R Lunches but you can still find the video links if you missed one! Read more about it

item.title: We Data Live on YouTube
item.description: By David Munoz Tord, Fabrice Hategekimana and Vestin Hategekimana Live of December 29 edited in which we present in more detail WeData, its functioning and its future. Read more about it

item.title: Data Manipulation with R
item.description: By David Munoz Tord Goal: Learn more about data manipulation: how to pivot, join and filter data using {dplyr} and {tidyr} packages. Read more about it

item.title: What a tool! - An ignorant perspective
item.description: By Fabrice Hategekimana In this playlist are all the videos presenting useful tools when coding or when you are a student. Read more about it

item.title: Learn Terminal Basics
item.description: By Fabrice Hategekimana Goal: To initiate people who would like to start with Python by starting with the basics or the basics or people who want to reinforce their knowledge by going through important concepts in programming. Read more about it

item.title: Data Exploration with R
item.description: By David Munoz Tord Goal: Learn about data exploration and familiarize yourself with some of the basic functions of the tidyverse. Read more about it

item.title: Code Hygiene. Don't Laugh it off !
item.description: By Fabrice Hategekimana Goal: Introduce the basics of hygiene in the code to have clean and reusable scripts. Workflow and refactoring are also important elements to achieve good results. We explain everything in our videos! Read more about it

item.title: Satistics with R
item.description: By Vestin Hategekimana Goal: To cover the structure of a classical statistical analysis with R. We will then go into more depth on each part while presenting packages in the language that make the work easier. Although this playlist is designed for social science students, it can be useful for anyone. Read more about it

item.title: Learn Terminal Basics
item.description: By Fabrice Hategekimana Video series on terminal automation. We explain why working with the terminal is still a good idea. Read more about it

item.title: Data Viz Fundamentals with R
item.description: By David Munoz Tord Goal: Go over the basics of data visualization with R and learn more advanced concepts using the ggplot package. Read more about it

item.title: Learn R Basics
item.description: By Vestin Hategekimana Goal: To initiate people who would like to start with R by starting with the basics or the basics or people who want to reinforce their knowledge by going through important concepts in programming. Read more about it

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
